title.narrative: EVIDENCE,RESOURCES,POLICIES,STRATEGIES ON HIV

description.narrative: By 2021, the Government generates evidence, mobilizes resources and has policies and strategies in place in line with global recommendations for HIV, which contributes to Fast-Track The End Of Hiv/Aids, Hiv â€“ General. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Evaluations, Research And Data. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Improved, scaled up and equitable use of proven HIV prevention, treatment, care and support interventions

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2021, the Government generates evidence, mobilizes resources and has policies and strategies in place in line with globalrecommendations for HIV

description.narrative: UNICEF supported the implementation of the Global Fund US$ 369 million investment to the Government of Tanzania, particularly enhancing quality of HIV services for children and adolescent girls and young women. The Prime Minister launched theNational Accelerated Action and Investment Agenda for Adolescent Health and Well Beingwith support from UNICEF, providing a critical framework for action. To achieve the elimination of mother to child transmission (eMTCT) of HIV, Hepatitis and Syphilis and the global AIDS targets, UNICEF and partners supported the Ministry of Health to develop an operational eMTCT plan and the Health Sector HIV Strategic Plan. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:17/12/2021

title.narrative: Existence of national household survey based data on HIV disaggregated by age and sex collected within the preceding 5 years

baseline.value: 2011/12 AIDS Indicator Survey (to be updated in early 2017 with THIA 2016)

target.value: 2021:HIV secondary data analysis of DHS and THIS (2019); THIS 2021 (or equivalent)

title.narrative: Availability of age and sex disaggregated HIV programmatic data through harmonised M&E systems(43585)

baseline.value: Age-disaggregated HIV data for adolescents unavailable (DHIS2, CTC)

target.value: 2021:HIV data for adolescents (10-14, 15-19, 20-24 years) available (DHIS2, CTC)

title.narrative: Rescurces mobilized for children and AIDS through large funding mechanisims such as the Global Fund to Fight AIDS, Tuberculosis and malaria and PEPFAR(65008)

baseline.value: GFATM grant approved, including 16 mill USD for AGYW (2018); PEPFAR DREAMS approved for USD 100 mill (2018)

target.value: 2021:UNICEF in PEPFAR and GFATM planning and programme review processes; UNICEF on national AGYW steering committee; Reports on implementation progress and funding levels through national coordination mech

actual.value: 2021:UNICEF in PEPFAR and GFATM planning and programme review processes; UNICEF in national AGYW steering committee; Reports on implementation progress and funding levels through national coordination mechanisms

title.narrative: National HIV Strategic plan/guidance for care and treatment that are aligned to Global targets and the most recent WHO recommendations for care and treatment of children , adolescents and pregnant/breast feeding women

baseline.value: WHO ART guidelines introduced in 2017; HSHSP IV launched 2017; National Service Delivery Model developed 2017

target.value: 2021:National HIV Treatment guidelines, including service delivery model for children and adolescents implemented; Mid term review of HSHSP IV; Updated ART guidelines; Age of conscent for HIV lowered

actual.value: 2021:National HIV Treatment guidelines, including service delivery model for children and adolescents implementation ongoing, new HSHSP is under development so mid-term review is not planned anymore, ART guidelines already updated, age of consent for HIV lower
